intro: Ilex tolucana, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are an important food source for birds. Ilex tolucana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and year-round structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
